intro: Allantodia incompta, commonly known as the white-flowered allantodia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
